commit_message:
Global environment ignores files starting with dot

The _list_environment_files() method was modified to ignore all the
files, in the heat.common.config.environment_dir, with names that starts
with a dot. This method uses glob.glob instead of os.listdir.

Change-Id: Ida84472adef771a7310277fdb549d358877fe739
Closes-Bug: #1272114
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/71/68971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import glob return glob.glob(os.path.join(env_dir, '*')) for file_path in _list_environment_files(env_dir): try: LOG.error(_('Failed to parse %(file_path)s') % { 'file_path': file_path}) LOG.error(_('Failed to read %(file_path)s') % { 'file_path': file_path})
deleted_lines: return os.listdir(env_dir) for env_name in _list_environment_files(env_dir): try: file_path = os.path.join(env_dir, env_name) LOG.error(_('Failed to parse %(dir)s/%(name)s') % { 'dir': env_dir, 'name': env_name}) LOG.error(_('Failed to read %(dir)s/%(name)s') % { 'dir': env_dir, 'name': env_name})

commit_message:
raw_template hot parameter type data migration

Changes were made to the hot syntax which prevent invalid templates
already present in the database from being loaded as part of a stack
list. This database migration forces the parameter schema type to
be lowercase.

Change-Id: Icf43c21ee8ce2e00f036a79a65305bb730a5aea1
Partial-Bug: #1274288

commit_message:
Make nova-network use Network to create networks

This makes nova-network manager use the Network.create() method
to do the work of creating networks. It also makes the rpcapi
use the NovaObjectSerializer since this is the first change that
makes nova-network return or take an object via RPC.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: Ida9a05ac249ff168075f87e5dbdad6bc23e69561

subject: Make obj_to_primitive() handle netaddr types
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 15:27:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6c8e8de0b3608e7fb243f019ff25db61d12eafb4', 'message': 'Make obj_to_primitive() handle netaddr types

This makes base.obj_to_primitive() handle netaddr.IPAddress() and
netaddr.IPNetwork() objects so that they properly become strings
in the primitive format, which provides compatibility with existing
network dicts.

commit_message:
Make obj_to_primitive() handle netaddr types

This makes base.obj_to_primitive() handle netaddr.IPAddress() and
netaddr.IPNetwork() objects so that they properly become strings
in the primitive format, which provides compatibility with existing
network dicts.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I098d775a2a792073b2777495d665846f399ecf3e

added_lines: def test_obj_to_primitive_with_ip_addr(self): class TestObject(base.NovaObject): fields = {'addr': fields.IPAddressField(), 'cidr': fields.IPNetworkField()} obj = TestObject(addr='1.2.3.4', cidr='1.1.1.1/16') self.assertEqual({'addr': '1.2.3.4', 'cidr': '1.1.1.1/16'}, base.obj_to_primitive(obj))

commit_message:
Add Network object

This adds a Network object to provide services and modeling
for nova-network and its use of the current SQLAlchemy Network
model.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I7f943cda32fc98b3b03cdbb5d68e0c741053afaa

'}]
commit_message:
Make service workers gracefully handle service creation race

Right now, service workers can race to create their service record
in the database. This makes a NotFound...Exists pattern not fail
when the service record shows up due to a successful sibling.

Change-Id: I3e912beeb953c85189f44171d958e9402abc01ae

added_lines: def test_service_check_create_race(self): self.manager_mock = self.mox.CreateMock(FakeManager) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(sys.modules[__name__], 'FakeManager', use_mock_anything=True) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.manager_mock, 'init_host') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.manager_mock, 'pre_start_hook') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.manager_mock, 'create_rpc_dispatcher') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.manager_mock, 'post_start_hook') FakeManager(host=self.host).AndReturn(self.manager_mock) # init_host is called before any service record is created self.manager_mock.init_host() db.service_get_by_args(mox.IgnoreArg(), self.host, self.binary ).AndRaise(exception.NotFound) ex = exception.ServiceTopicExists(host='foo', topic='bar') db.service_create(mox.IgnoreArg(), mox.IgnoreArg() ).AndRaise(ex) class TestException(Exception): pass db.service_get_by_args(mox.IgnoreArg(), self.host, self.binary ).AndRaise(TestException) self.mox.ReplayAll() serv = service.Service(self.host, self.binary, self.topic, 'nova.tests.test_service.FakeManager') self.assertRaises(TestException, serv.start)

Don't run pep8 tests with -P

Sync the -P option from other project to don't run PEP8 when running it.

commit_message:
Add futures library to global requirements

The concurrent.futures lib will be used to implement parallel file
downloads in Ironic project. Basing on discussion in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/63904/1 we decided to use futures
instead of working with Thread directly. Add 2.1.3 as minimal
version because the docs used during the development are for 2.1.3.

Change-Id: I94f8b5225ed380251a6d2e4ff6889c1c1bcb5b57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/49/66349/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update all the glance manpages

Finish updating the glance manpages:
  - Update and modernize all files and references
  - Add a new manpage for glance-replicator
  - Move the common configuration options to common files for
    easier maintenance and less redundancy

Change-Id: If2cbcc30f2761b187038f39324c7698de4eb2ab9
Closes-Bug: #1238366

commit_message:
Docstrings for ipmitool

Cleaned up and added docstrings for some functions/methods in ipmitool.py.

Change-Id: I6cc845fe1cc24dac3c27b9efb06c009d7f0374af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/65/68665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Makes a temporary file that contains the password.""" """Gets the parameters required for ipmitool to access the node. :param node: the Node of interest. :returns: dictionary of parameters. :raises: InvalidParameterValue if any required parameters are missing. """ """Execute the ipmitool command. This uses the lanplus interface to communicate with the BMC device driver. :param driver_info: the ipmitool parameters for accessing a node. :param command: the ipmitool command to be executed. :returns: (stdout, stderr) from executing the command. :raises: some Exception from making the password file or from executing the command. """ """Turn the power ON for this node. :param driver_info: the ipmitool parameters for accessing a node. :returns: one of ironic.common.states POWER_ON or ERROR. :raises: IPMIFailure on an error from ipmitool (from _power_status call). """ """Turn the power OFF for this node. :param driver_info: the ipmitool parameters for accessing a node. :returns: one of ironic.common.states POWER_OFF or ERROR. :raises: IPMIFailure on an error from ipmitool (from _power_status call). """ :raises: InvalidParameterValue if required ipmi parameters are missing. """Get the current power state. :param task: a TaskManager instance. :param node: The Node. :returns: one of ironic.common.states POWER_OFF, POWER_ON or ERROR. :raises: InvalidParameterValue if required ipmi parameters are missing. :raises: IPMIFailure on an error from ipmitool (from _power_status call). """ """Turn the power on or off. :param task: a TaskManager instance. :param node: The Node. :param pstate: The desired power state, one of ironic.common.states POWER_ON, POWER_OFF. :raises: InvalidParameterValue if required ipmi parameters are missing or if an invalid power state was specified. :raises: PowerStateFailure if the power couldn't be set to pstate. """ """Cycles the power to a node. :param task: a TaskManager instance. :param node: The Node. :raises: InvalidParameterValue if required ipmi parameters are missing. :raises: PowerStateFailure if the final state of the node is not POWER_ON. """ :raises: InvalidParameterValue if an invalid boot device is specified or if required ipmi parameters are missing.
deleted_lines: """Turn the power to this node ON.""" """Turn the power to this node OFF.""" :raises: InvalidParameterValue """Get the current power state.""" """Turn the power on or off.""" """Cycles the power to a node.""" :raises: InvalidParameterValue if an invalid boot device is specified.

commit_message:
Make scaling out a feature for merge.py.

This is a simple implementation designed to work with our current
non-HOT approach. We need to adjust our templates a little to support
this - though future work could make that better, it's orthogonal to
this effort.

Change-Id: I555617e5f24a5882de915f057dc02e008c81e753

commit_message:
Add create_iscsi_target stub to TargetAdmin

This should be defined in TargetAdmin, as it is assumed to be
present in all subclasses by callers.

IetAdm and LioAdm may need additional work to behave as desired
in all circumstances (such as volume extend), but this should
at least stabilize things in the meantime.

Closes-Bug: 1273480

Change-Id: Iac1381286ea07982e6db7f7c7abf3f9100e4be50

commit_message:
Extra_spec containing '/' can't be deleted

This patch validates the keys of the extra specs
before setting them.
This will make possible to remove those keys.
It allows alphanumeric characters, underscores,
periods, colons and hyphens.

Change-Id: Ic2e5d7ce42c8ecb7ee45cd168bd008035fd4bbdf
Closes-Bug: #1259711

commit_message:
Remove Nova v3 XML tests completely

We have decided that XML support is removed from Nova v3 API and
the tests also are removed from Tempest.
Most code has been removed from Tempest, but there are some code
related to Nova v3 XML tests yet.

This patch removes them from Tempest.

Part of bp:remove-v3-xml-api

Change-Id: Ie3c595fb77143e58e30404c42f358d6443a52c0b

commit_message:
Give no background color to the pie charts

Currently, we hard-code a white background color for the pie charts.
This however is unneeded (as far as I can tell), and makes things look
ugly whenever the horizon css is changed to not have a white background.

Change-Id: Iac4fc1b9f77bddedc92eb627b22a8add88a0b35d

commit_message:
Add missing parameter in call to _load_one_plugin

Stevedore 0.14 introduced a new paramter to the private method
ExtensionManager._load_one_plugin(). This broke our unit test suite, and
this patch adds that parameter to the call.

This patch supports both Stevedore < 0.14 and >= 0.14. Once we can pin
the version to >= 0.14, we should remove support for the old-style
call to _load_one_plugin.

For reference, we are directly calling this private method to provide a
mock-able extension manager and a corresponding fake extension for
testing the Conductor and the various extensions it loads.

Change-Id: Ib51f841af00548c3e20128f44a4b7a48422c1aa9
Closes-bug: #1273472

commit_message:
VMware: unnecessary session reconnection

An error FAULT_NOT_AUTHENTICATED could imply that there is a problem
with the backend or that no values were found (for example there are
no running VMS). In the latter case the connection should not
be restarted.

The patch also ensures that the session is restarted if there are
connection issues.

This issue occasionally causes CI issues with minesweeper.

Closes-bug: #1265512

Co-authored-by: Shawn Harsock <hartsocks@vmware.com>

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py

Change-Id: Ibfa83d0b5b93680890aad8c88c041fa344765448
(cherry picked from commit 55296828a7d7a03736a21d846da15571ca22ec9e)

plumgrid and bigswitch don't).

Apply this migration script only for plugins that are
stated in the original migration script adding agents
table (511471cc46b_agent_ext_model_supp.py).

Related-Bug: #1254246

Change-Id: I7915ef8d183782eb5d46ac47f45014aa9e9640fb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the migration adding a UC to agents table

The migration script mistakenly assumes that all core
plugins use agents extension, which is not true (e.g.
plumgrid and bigswitch don't).

Apply this migration script only for plugins that are
stated in the original migration script adding agents
table (511471cc46b_agent_ext_model_supp.py).

Related-Bug: #1254246

Change-Id: I7915ef8d183782eb5d46ac47f45014aa9e9640fb

commit_message:
Adds dmcrypt utility module

Patch adds a module for manipulating dmcrypt devices.

Implements: blueprint encrypt-ephemeral-storage
Change-Id: I308b9f26c382b332c02f13aa1d5f0a830e9ef277
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/60621/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 The Johns Hopkins University/Applied Physics Laboratory # All Rights Reserved # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from oslo.config import cfg from nova.virt.libvirt import utils CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.import_opt('enabled', 'nova.compute.api', group='ephemeral_storage_encryption') CONF.import_opt('cipher', 'nova.compute.api', group='ephemeral_storage_encryption') CONF.import_opt('key_size', 'nova.compute.api', group='ephemeral_storage_encryption') def cryptsetup(target, device, key): cmd = ('cryptsetup', 'create', target, device, '--cipher=' + CONF.ephemeral_storage_encryption.cipher, '--key-size=' + str(CONF.ephemeral_storage_encryption.key_size), '--key-file=-') key = ''.join(map(lambda byte: hex(byte)[2:], key)) utils.execute(*cmd, process_input=key, run_as_root=True) def cryptdestroy(target): utils.execute('cryptsetup', 'remove', target, run_as_root=True) def list_encrypted_volumes(): return [dmdev for dmdev in os.listdir('/dev/mapper') if dmdev.endswith('-dmcrypt')]

commit_message:
Adds ephemeral_key_uuid field to instance

Patch adds a field to instance for storing the uuid of
the key used to encrypt instance's ephemeral storage.

Implements: blueprint encrypt-ephemeral-storage

commit_message:
Renamed file 70-trove to 70-trove.sh

Reason: Devstack not installing trove
        stack.sh ignores the trove installation script(70-trove)

Change-Id: I3f179a6b5ded46e9f96a1c4bcc673ec52fa8bf0e
Closes-Bug: #1274022

commit_message:
Sync up with oslo-incubator

be81d6b Cleanup unused log related code
e53fe85 strutils bool_from_string, allow specified default
12bcdb7 Remove vim header
12d3bbc Add method quote_plus in module py3kcompat.urlutils
afdbc0a Fix E501 in individual openstack projects

Oslo Version:
8dee4b6 Merge "remove extra newlines that eventlet seems to add"
Thu, 23 Jan 2014 14:26:42 +0530 (08:56 +0000)

Change-Id: I7348e797a4a78ec20dff77ebdbb41bb8c6068b34

added_lines: import inspectimport six class ConnectionRefused(ClientException): """Cannot connect to API service.""" pass # _code_map contains all the classes that have http_status attribute. _code_map = dict( (getattr(obj, 'http_status', None), obj) for name, obj in six.iteritems(vars(sys.modules[__name__])) if inspect.isclass(obj) and getattr(obj, 'http_status', False) )
deleted_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # In Python 2.4 Exception is old-style and thus doesn't have a __subclasses__() # so we can do this: # _code_map = dict((c.http_status, c) # for c in HttpError.__subclasses__()) _code_map = {} for obj in sys.modules[__name__].__dict__.values(): if isinstance(obj, type): try: http_status = obj.http_status except AttributeError: pass else: if http_status: _code_map[http_status] = obj

commit_message:
Remove xml unit tests for v3 api plugins

Remove a bunch of unit tests for XML support in v3 compute API plugins.
This is another step towarding removing XML support completely from this
API.

Part of blueprint remove-v3-xml-api

Change-Id: Ibc35791cd8593b523ff21d9f604d0263e6da2b0a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/69736/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from nova.tests import matchers from nova.tests import utils class TestServerActionXMLDeserializer(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestServerActionXMLDeserializer, self).setUp() ext_info = plugins.LoadedExtensionInfo() servers_controller = servers.ServersController(extension_info=ext_info) self.deserializer = servers.ActionDeserializer(servers_controller) def test_create_image(self): serial_request = """ <create_image xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" name="new-server-test"/>""" request = self.deserializer.deserialize(serial_request, 'action') expected = { "create_image": { "name": "new-server-test", }, } self.assertEqual(request['body'], expected) def test_create_image_with_metadata(self): serial_request = """ <create_image xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" name="new-server-test"> <metadata> <meta key="key1">value1</meta> </metadata> </create_image>""" request = self.deserializer.deserialize(serial_request, 'action') expected = { "create_image": { "name": "new-server-test", "metadata": {"key1": "value1"}, }, } self.assertEqual(request['body'], expected) def test_reboot(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <reboot xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" type="HARD"/>""" request = self.deserializer.deserialize(serial_request, 'action') expected = { "reboot": { "type": "HARD", }, } self.assertEqual(request['body'], expected) def test_reboot_no_type(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <reboot xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"/>""" self.assertRaises(AttributeError, self.deserializer.deserialize, serial_request, 'action') def test_resize(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <resize xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" flavor_ref="http://localhost/flavors/3"/>""" request = self.deserializer.deserialize(serial_request, 'action') expected = { "resize": {"flavor_ref": "http://localhost/flavors/3"}, } self.assertEqual(request['body'], expected) def test_resize_no_flavor_ref(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <resize xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"/>""" self.assertRaises(AttributeError, self.deserializer.deserialize, serial_request, 'action') def test_confirm_resize(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <confirm_resize xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"/>""" request = self.deserializer.deserialize(serial_request, 'action') expected = { "confirm_resize": None, } self.assertEqual(request['body'], expected) def test_revert_resize(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <revert_resize xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"/>""" request = self.deserializer.deserialize(serial_request, 'action') expected = { "revert_resize": None, } self.assertEqual(request['body'], expected) def test_rebuild(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rebuild xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" name="new-server-test" image_ref="http://localhost/images/1"> <metadata> <meta key="My Server Name">Apache1</meta> </metadata> </rebuild>""" request = self.deserializer.deserialize(serial_request, 'action') expected = { "rebuild": { "name": "new-server-test", "image_ref": "http://localhost/images/1", "metadata": { "My Server Name": "Apache1", }, }, } self.assertThat(request['body'], matchers.DictMatches(expected)) def test_rebuild_minimum(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rebuild xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" image_ref="http://localhost/images/1"/>""" request = self.deserializer.deserialize(serial_request, 'action') expected = { "rebuild": { "image_ref": "http://localhost/images/1", }, } self.assertThat(request['body'], matchers.DictMatches(expected)) def test_rebuild_no_image_ref(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rebuild xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" name="new-server-test"> <metadata> <meta key="My Server Name">Apache1</meta> </metadata> </rebuild>""" self.assertRaises(AttributeError, self.deserializer.deserialize, serial_request, 'action') def test_rebuild_blank_name(self): serial_request = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rebuild xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" image_ref="http://localhost/images/1" name=""/>""" self.assertRaises(AttributeError, self.deserializer.deserialize, serial_request, 'action') def test_corrupt_xml(self): """Should throw a 400 error on corrupt xml.""" self.assertRaises( exception.MalformedRequestBody, self.deserializer.deserialize, utils.killer_xml_body())

commit_message:
Remove v3 xml API sample tests

This is a step toward removing XML support from the v3 compute API.
First, we need to remove all of the tests that would fail once we start
ripping out the real code.

Part of blueprint remove-v3-xml-api

Change-Id: Ie2c280d5ea1e6b8756535deb05982a92561552db

commit_message:
Checking for vim tag

In https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1229324, vim tag will
 be removed.

This patch adds the function of checking vim tag.

Change-Id: I614cedb6b6b8b376939b45bd21d3f3a6594b9102

subject: add support for Django-1.6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-13 02:50:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/dc757396c840c7a0547df63821d36d2c3fe52e47', 'message': 'Fix inappropriate logouts on load-balanced Horizon

The session timeout code in the horizon/middleware.py can cause
inappropriate timeouts/logouts when running Horizon behind a load
balancer on two machines that are slightly out of sync time-wise.

Use timestamps rather than datetime as the arithmetic is simpler.

Closes-bug: #1243277
(cherry-picked from commit 13355dacdbfa9ef14a4e1c16afeffaece5c13a39,
 minus the unrelated settings.py changes.)

Change-Id: I332ba18005284774a53fb3cb8c6e51bca1480ded
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-17 10:55:57.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/middleware.py', 'horizon/middleware.py', 'openstack_dashboard/settings.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1f6d5faed4ac6cf61b54cad2057203523a044343', 'message': 'add support for Django-1.6

Sessions now store JSON instead of pickled objects.

Partially-implements blueprint django-1point6

Conflicts:
	horizon/middleware.py
	openstack_dashboard/settings.py

Change-Id: I332ba18005284774a53fb3cb8c6e51bca1480ded
(cherry picked from commit 13355dacdbfa9ef14a4e1c16afeffaece5c13a39)
'}]
commit_message:
add support for Django-1.6

Sessions now store JSON instead of pickled objects.

Partially-implements blueprint django-1point6

Conflicts:
	horizon/middleware.py
	openstack_dashboard/settings.py

Change-Id: I332ba18005284774a53fb3cb8c6e51bca1480ded
(cherry picked from commit 13355dacdbfa9ef14a4e1c16afeffaece5c13a39)

commit_message:
changing the routes for the api to be clear

The map.resource creates a ton of excess routes that are not necessary
for our service. This will make things more explicit and we will know
which routes are being used from viewing api routes.

Implements blueprint clean-up-trove-api-routes

Change-Id: I149642188f42ffdbf8ff11b3acc79daf76dcb2b0

commit_message:
Install bc with all distribution

After commit def4c141 the bc is requred for devstack install on minimal
image, commit fbe12f98 fixed the issue with ubuntu, but not with other
distribution.

Adding bc to the files/rpms-suse/general and files/rpms/general.

Change-Id: Ieb2e3e2af454bca03bb3d7565ff731dc357e699f

commit_message:
Add missing tenant_id param behinds os-quota-sets

These two APIs missing tenant_id param.
GET v2/{tenant_id}/os-quota-sets Shows quotas for a tenant.
PUT v2/{tenant_id}/os-quota-sets Updates quotas for a tenant.
Should be like:
GET v2/{tenant_id}/os-quota-sets/{tenant_id} Shows quotas for a tenant.
PUT v2/{tenant_id}/os-quota-sets/{tenant_id} Updates quotas for a tenant.

Change-Id: I07581b69835cde3063b109cae564a591386762c8
Closes-bug: 1274153

added_lines: class MonitorMixin(): def _get_monitor_display_name(self, monitor): fields = ['type', 'delay', 'max_retries', 'timeout'] if monitor.type in ['HTTP', 'HTTPS']: fields.extend(['url_path', 'expected_codes', 'http_method']) name = _("%(type)s url:%(url_path)s " "method:%(http_method)s codes:%(expected_codes)s " "delay:%(delay)d retries:%(max_retries)d " "timeout:%(timeout)d") else: name = _("%(type)s delay:%(delay)d " "retries:%(max_retries)d " "timeout:%(timeout)d") params = dict((key, getattr(monitor, key)) for key in fields) return name % params class AddPMAssociationAction(workflows.Action, MonitorMixin): display_name = self._get_monitor_display_name(m) monitor_id_choices.append((m.id, display_name))class DeletePMAssociationAction(workflows.Action, MonitorMixin): monitors = api.lbaas.pool_health_monitors_get(request) for m in monitors: if m.id in context['pool_monitors']: display_name = self._get_monitor_display_name(m) monitor_id_choices.append((m.id, display_name))
deleted_lines: class AddPMAssociationAction(workflows.Action): monitor_id_choices.append((m.id, m.id))class DeletePMAssociationAction(workflows.Action): for m_id in context['pool_monitors']: monitor_id_choices.append((m_id, m_id))

commit_message:
Adds COMPRESS_OFFLINE option to local_settings

The Ubuntu Havana packages includes pre-compressed
assets and does not install a package that provides
lesscpy.

This re-adds COMPRESS_OFFLINE=True to utilize this
and avoid a broken Horizon install on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I6671938a87744a4dd0b84021ca87cd49aea10741
Closes-Bug: #1272441
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/77/68977/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The Ubuntu package includes pre-compressed JS and compiled CSS to allow # offline compression by default. To enable online compression, install # the python-lesscpy package and disable the following option. COMPRESS_OFFLINE = True

commit_message:
NetApp fix free space as zero during 1st vol stats update

NetApp clustered ontap drivers report space as zero
till first 60 seconds of driver start. This is causing
discomfort for some performance sensitive deployements.
This was due to async nature of the NetApp stats collection job.
Job is changed to sync at driver start to improve customer
experience.

Change-Id: I7d5cbf590897a0d328ece3a60516c92c0ad0ee7f
Closes-bug: #1253660
(cherry picked from commit 585f34ff7798ad271121d432e0cae8820bc54389)

commit_message:
Call rally-manage with warning when openstack-rally-manage is used

Currently when openstack-rally-manage is used, args are passed through
to rally, not rally-manage. This patch fixes this situation.

added_lines: from glanceclient import exc from rally import exceptions from rally.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ def image_exists(param_name): def image_exists_validator(**kwargs): image_id = kwargs.get(param_name) glanceclient = kwargs.get("clients").get("glance") try: glanceclient.images.get(image=image_id) except exc.HTTPNotFound: message = _("Image with id '%s' not found") % image_id raise exceptions.InvalidScenarioArgument(message=message) return image_exists_validator

commit_message:
RootReport through Taskmanager

Reason:
- guestagent should be free from direct Trove back-end DB connection.
Changes:
- extending taskmanager provisioning flow;
- taskmanager reports about root creation;
- tests.

Closes-bug: #1257489
Change-Id: I5f2502d8b61542658682a5ff74735749e5a1ca2b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/10/59410/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from trove.extensions.mysql import models as mysql_models def _create_rh(self): new_id = generate_uuid() history = mysql_models.RootHistory(new_id, 'root') return new_id, history.save() def _get_root_history(self, id): return mysql_models.RootHistory.load(None, id) def test_report_user_create_first_time(self): root_id = generate_uuid() ret = self.cond_mgr.report_user_created(None, root_id, 'root') self.assertEqual(root_id, ret.id) def test_report_user_use_loaded(self): root_id, history = self._create_rh() ret = self.cond_mgr.report_user_created(None, root_id, 'root') self.assertEqual(history.user, ret.user) self.assertEqual(history.id, ret.id)

commit_message:
Adds COMPRESS_OFFLINE option to local_settings

The Ubuntu Havana packages includes pre-compressed
assets and does not install a package that provides
lesscpy.

This re-adds COMPRESS_OFFLINE=True to utilize this
and avoid a broken Horizon install on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I6671938a87744a4dd0b84021ca87cd49aea10741
Closes-Bug: #1272441

commit_message:
Added configuration for Glance to authenticate via Keystone

Apparently the existing instructions lack the configuration keys
necessary for Glance to authenticate via Keystone which breaks various
features. I added 'flavor = keystone' to glance-api.conf and
glance-registry.conf to resolve this issue. However, this generated
a warning about the lack of 'auth_uri' which I also added to resolve
this issue. This patch also includes general clarifications.

Since this patch plays a significant role in building a functional
environment, I recommend considering it for backporting to Havana.

Change-Id: If112a7d039f3943238e915ef0066765529c7d668
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1262755
Closes-Bug: #1267854
(cherry picked from commit 57fee4ea3392ccc34e599cf85e8fcb9f5aa8a862)

added_lines: <step> <para>Configure the Image Service to use the Identity Service for authentication.</para> <para os="rhel;centos;fedora;sles;opensuse">Run the following commands and replace <replaceable>GLANCE_PASS</replaceable> with the password you chose for the <literal>glance</literal> user in the Identity Service:</para> <screen os="rhel;centos;fedora;sles;opensuse"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-api.conf keystone_authtoken \ auth_uri http://<replaceable>controller</replaceable>:5000</userinput> auth_host <replaceable>controller</replaceable></userinput> admin_user glance</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-api.conf keystone_authtoken \<prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-api.conf paste_deploy \ flavor keystone</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf keystone_authtoken \ auth_uri http://<replaceable>controller</replaceable>:5000</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf keystone_authtoken \ auth_host <replaceable>controller</replaceable></userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf keystone_authtoken \ admin_tenant_name service</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf keystone_authtoken \ admin_user glance</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf keystone_authtoken \ admin_password <replaceable>GLANCE_PASS</replaceable></userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf paste_deploy \ flavor keystone</userinput></screen> <para os="ubuntu">Edit the <filename>/etc/glance/glance-api.conf</filename> and <filename>/etc/glance/glance-registry.conf</filename> files. Replace <replaceable>GLANCE_PASS</replaceable> with the password you chose for the <literal>glance</literal> user in the Identity Service.</para> <substeps os="ubuntu"> <step> <para>Add the following keys under the <literal>[keystone_authtoken]</literal> section:</para> <programlisting language="ini">[keystone_authtoken] ... auth_uri = http://<replaceable>controller</replaceable>:5000admin_password = <replaceable>GLANCE_PASS</replaceable></programlisting> </step> <step> <para>Add the following key under the <literal>[paste_deploy]</literal> section:</para> <programlisting language="ini">[paste_deploy] ... flavor = keystone</programlisting> </step> </substeps> <para os="centos">On CentOS, you may need to copy these files to the correct location.</para>admin_password=<replaceable>GLANCE_PASS</replaceable></programlisting>

commit_message:
Start the nova-network service instead of restarting it (minor edit)

The fourth (4) step of 'Configure networking' in the 'Configure Compute services'
chapter (RHEL, CentOS, Fedora), says: start the network service, but in the command
of the step it restarts the network service. This results to a warning that the
openstack-nova-network service was not able to stop.
This commit just changes the argument of the service command to start.

Change-Id: I348f63d89740f9935390e4861b68fe48f8fb24cf
backport: havana

commit_message:
Update the glance notifier option for icehouse

The notifier_strategy option is deprecated, replaced by the
notification_driver option.

Change-Id: I1bd2c777dc7e502fc9774a75230b9e516631207f

commit_message:
Fix glance configuration for ceilometer

Modify /etc/glance/glance-api.conf, not /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf.

Change-Id: I3725a6578fcad6c49b2fc1cd9495d391157e714b
Closes-Bug: #1269657
backport: havana

subject: glance requires pyOpenSSL>=0.11
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-15 15:12:05.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/b7bc90e08cd6ceb63cf29d1ab2819e0bc125aa41', 'message': 'glance requires pyOpenSSL>=0.11

glance uses  OpenSSL.crypto.sign() and OpenSSL.crypto.verify(), which are new in pyOpenSSL 0.11
Fix global requirement first, then glance will use it

Change-Id: Id3b06be8ee203c3d15ccc2d846df0d0d8c4145ea
Partial-Bug: #1268966
'}]
commit_message:
glance requires pyOpenSSL>=0.11

glance uses  OpenSSL.crypto.sign() and OpenSSL.crypto.verify(), which are new in pyOpenSSL 0.11
Fix global requirement first, then glance will use it

Change-Id: Id3b06be8ee203c3d15ccc2d846df0d0d8c4145ea
Partial-Bug: #1268966
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/67/66867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The point of this change is to ensure that
these two docs are in sync and are complete with regards
to the descriptions of each method and their request
and response parameters:
http://api.openstack.org/api-ref-objectstorage.html
  (API Reference page for Object Storage)
http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-object-storage/1.0/content/
  (API Reference (or spec) for Object Storage)
In addition, the current documents don’t describe ACLs, FormPOST, TempURLs,
StaticWeb, Bulk Upload, Bulk Delete, the OPTIONS operation
(though this is implicit in CORS support) and maybe a couple of other things.
These items should be part of the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/64579/
review, which I'm still working on.

Co-Author: Donagh McCabe

commit_message:
Update object-api wadl for completeness and accuracy

The point of this change is to ensure that
these two docs are in sync and are complete with regards
to the descriptions of each method and their request
and response parameters:
http://api.openstack.org/api-ref-objectstorage.html
  (API Reference page for Object Storage)
http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-object-storage/1.0/content/
  (API Reference (or spec) for Object Storage)
In addition, the current documents don’t describe ACLs, FormPOST, TempURLs,
StaticWeb, Bulk Upload, Bulk Delete, the OPTIONS operation
(though this is implicit in CORS support) and maybe a couple of other things.
These items should be part of the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/64579/
review, which I'm still working on.
updated to add {name} for variables in metadata

Co-Author: Donagh McCabe

Partial-Bug: #1187119
Partial-Bug: #1214139

Change-Id: I82331b1c3cfc5b19f91f7ac1379476e6a9e6806d
author: diane fleming

Note that we create the project unconditionally to avoid problems

commit_message:
Create stack user domain project for each new stack

Create a stack user domain project when we store() each Stack,
so it can be used when creating any resources which require
creation of keystone users.

Note that we create the project unconditionally to avoid problems
on update, because we need to distinguish stacks which were created
before the transition to domain-users (where there may be resources
which have users in the default domain, hence the project==None will
correctly remove them on stack delete.

blueprint: instance-users
Change-Id: I5a077e2f815a5369477dc80557a002e985335e54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/92/69892/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove leftovers of "# noqa"

This patch set removes leftovers of "# noqa" from imports
added to import_exceptions.

It also adds "django.test.utils.override_settings" to
import_exceptions, so a few more "# noqa" tags become
unnecessary.

Closes-Bug: #1273647

Change-Id: I39f856ac3ea371a2fcab272bbf358d0243164b6d

commit_message:
3PAR iSCSI volumes attach to single nsp

Update the 3PAR iSCSI Driver to correctly identify
the least used iSCSI Node:Slot:Port (NSP) and only attach
the volume using that single NSP.

DocImpact: Driver now requires 3PAR firmware version 3.1.2 MU3
Ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/68513/

Change-Id: I1627e44a5168a7dbd19ea62312d65a00044753e9
Closes-Bug: #1269515

added_lines: # TODO: move these to the 3PAR Client VLUN_TYPE_EMPTY = 1 VLUN_TYPE_PORT = 2 VLUN_TYPE_HOST = 3 VLUN_TYPE_MATCHED_SET = 4 VLUN_TYPE_HOST_SET = 5 def _create_3par_vlun(self, volume, hostname, nsp): try: if nsp is None: self.client.createVLUN(volume, hostname=hostname, auto=True) else: port = self.build_portPos(nsp) self.client.createVLUN(volume, hostname=hostname, auto=True, portPos=port) def create_vlun(self, volume, host, nsp=None): self._create_3par_vlun(volume_name, host['name'], nsp) # VLUN Type of MATCHED_SET 4 requires the port to be provided if self.VLUN_TYPE_MATCHED_SET == vlun['type']: self.client.deleteVLUN(volume_name, vlun['lun'], hostname, vlun['portPos']) else: self.client.deleteVLUN(volume_name, vlun['lun'], hostname) def build_portPos(self, nsp): split = nsp.split(":") portPos = {} portPos['node'] = int(split[0]) portPos['slot'] = int(split[1]) portPos['cardPort'] = int(split[2]) return portPos
deleted_lines: def _create_3par_vlun(self, volume, hostname): try: self.client.createVLUN(volume, hostname=hostname, auto=True) def create_vlun(self, volume, host): self._create_3par_vlun(volume_name, host['name']) self.client.deleteVLUN(volume_name, vlun['lun'], hostname)

commit_message:
Hyper-V:Preserve config drive image after the instance is resized

If we configure config_drive_cdrom=True in nova.conf,
the config drive image will be lost after the instance
is resized on hyperV. This is because nova compute will
not copy the disk file if the file's ResourceSubType
is not 'Virtual Hard Disk'.

This commit adds 'Virtual CD/DVD Disk' into disk_resources
to preserve the config drive image after the instance is
resized.

Closes-Bug: #1250324

Change-Id: Ia125a8b132d194ddc2230754fd1b813698b410a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/75/55975/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: disk_resources = [r for r in rasds if r.ResourceSubType == self._IDE_DISK_RES_SUB_TYPE]

commit_message:
Updates for RHEL 6.5

* Updated documentation to reflect the changed image name
* Updates to add wget since it's no longer part of the base image as of 6.5
* Update the heat template image name reference
* Removal of epel base dependencies that are now part of the base image as of
6.5

Change-Id: I8f87b2baa2d96d05849647d2fb3a43471fe65066

thanks to slage: at the bottom of devtest_testenv, there is a
echo to $JSONFILE which should instead be $TE_DATAFILE.
Also fixed the fact that seed_ip was being grabbed from SEEDIP
but devtest_seed defines it as SEED_IP

Change-Id: I6a92439c612fa5e146c7c6747267204d4d250ba9

commit_message:
Fix typo in seed_ip and make sure testenv config file initialised

thanks to slage: at the bottom of devtest_testenv, there is a
echo to $JSONFILE which should instead be $TE_DATAFILE.
Also fixed the fact that seed_ip was being grabbed from SEEDIP
but devtest_seed defines it as SEED_IP

Change-Id: I6a92439c612fa5e146c7c6747267204d4d250ba9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/71/69871/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export SEED_IP=${SEED_IP:-''} echo "{\"host-ip\":\"$HOSTIP\", \"seed-ip\":\"$SEED_IP\", \"node-macs\":\"$MACS\"}" > $TE_DATAFILE

Account for the differnt locations of systemd units on openSUSE

added_lines: if [ "$DISTRO" = "openSUSE project" ]; then SYSTEMD_PATH=/usr/lib/systemd/system else SYSTEMD_PATH=/lib/systemd/system fi sed -i 's/\[Unit\]/\[Unit\]\nBefore=rc-local.service/g' $SYSTEMD_PATH/rabbitmq-server.service sed -i 's/\[Service\]/\[Service\]\nRestart=on-failure/g' $SYSTEMD_PATH/rabbitmq-server.service

commit_message:
Install glance-manage into /usr/local/bin

Instead of specifying the full path to glance-manage, install a
symlink to the command into /usr/local/bin and just use the command name
when we call it.  This allows a packaged version to get used if the
package install type was chosen.

Change-Id: I628c53cc0bc39915b35f1cdf075ce2fe097a8a4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/56/67956/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ln -s /opt/stack/venvs/glance/bin/glance-manage /usr/local/bin/glance-manage

commit_message:
Install heat-manage into /usr/local/bin

Instead of specifying the full path to heat-manage, install a
symlink to the command into /usr/local/bin and just use the command name
when we call it.  This allows a packaged version to get used if the
package install type was chosen.

Change-Id: I104cd6bea8bb5ead126f20fbdabede6488f54aa3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/54/67954/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ability to stop puppet deploy at every nodes

Change-Id: Ie8d0e82b04cc53f9cebe150415d00c1f3d9aa22e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/57/57657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def stop_puppet_deploy(reporter, task_id, nodes) nodes_uids = nodes.map { |n| n['uid'] }.uniq puppetd = MClient.new(Context.new(task_id, reporter), "puppetd", nodes_uids) puppetd.stop_and_disable end

commit_message:
generator: rename EXTRA_MODULES_FILE to RC_FILE

Tweak how we use this file to make it clear we can use it for things
other than the EXTRA_MODULES env variable.

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-28 17:18:09.000000000', 'files': ['elements/ironic/os-apply-config/etc/ironic/ironic.conf', 'elements/ironic-conductor/install.d/68-ironic-tftp-support'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/d147980b8c309005e5817b0d44b82060c47269b4', 'message': 'Ensure correct tftp directory ownership for Ironic

Ironic is currently unable to create tftp files due to tftp directory
being owned by the root user. Ironic is also unable to cache images

'}]
commit_message:
Ensure correct tftp directory ownership for Ironic

Ironic is currently unable to create tftp files due to tftp directory
being owned by the root user. Ironic is also unable to cache images
due to root ownership. This patch corrects both issues by setting the
proper ownership and moves /var/lib/ironic to /mnt/state/

Change-Id: Ia24b09cab88359de56ce4fa662f5f301835b91dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/13/69013/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # create tftpboot and cache directoriesinstall -d -m 0744 -o ironic -g ironic /var/lib/ironic # ensure tftpboot dir and all files in it are owned by ironic user chown ironic:ironic -R /tftpboot

commit_message:
Allows the user to create an object without file

Now the user can create an Object without providing an actual file
in the containers view. This will submit an object with 0 bytes size.
Additionally, the 'Download' button will not be available for objects
with 0 bytes size.

Implements: blueprint metadata-only-object
Change-Id: Ib2ff2462b73d16c971ad0dfc60aaae1b0bbf0924
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/79/68979/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_swift_upload_object_without_file(self): container = self.containers.first() obj = self.objects.first() swift_api = self.stub_swiftclient() swift_api.put_object(container.name, obj.name, None, headers={}) self.mox.ReplayAll() response = api.swift.swift_upload_object(self.request, container.name, obj.name, None) self.assertEqual(0, response['bytes'])

commit_message:
Don't set default for a nullable column

The "description" column for identity providers is nullable, so
there's no need to set the default for the value.

bp identity-providers

Change-Id: Ib623214f029085845c26609b506f70ae91502cfc

commit_message:
Update dev docs to include notification-agent

I was reading through the developer docs and noticed they had not been
updated for the new ceilometer-agent-notification service. This patch
adds the right command to put into the localrc. The command comes
straight out of devstack/lib/ceilometer.

Change-Id: I23b917b1c48b6474de2b29901fa039d8353f0eb0

commit_message:
Use dialect rather than a particular DB API driver

_get_connect_string() is too specific when choosing a DB API driver to be
used. We shouldn't force users to use neither psycopg2 nor MySQLdb as this is
not required for any actions provided by oslo.db. Specify only the dialect to
 be used and let SQLAlchemy choose one of the DB API drivers available.

Closes-Bug: #1256835
Change-Id: I685f9eecc77f2c1f920c83c5da653f3114a83679

commit_message:
support stevedore >= 0.14

the previous mocks made some very specific assumptions about the
behavior of an internal private method in stevedore, which changed
in 0.14. Make the mocks more flexible so they work regardless.

Change-Id: I5063c652c705fd512f90ff3897a4c590f7ba7c02
(cherry picked from commit 3992cfa3463fa7ab72a746cae38f7e212ad1a00a)

commit_message:
Add "gw" and "biosdevname" kernel params for pxe

"biosdevname=0" is needed in order to avoid random NIC naming on
some harware (DELL servers for example). "gw" paremeter is needed
for default route configuration. Also added "showmenu" param.

Change-Id: I57fb6f42fbd24adaa41cd2a99a59119c72c68a09

commit_message:
Fix federation documentation reference

The documentation for the federation extension referenced a class
that doesn't exist for the driver. Using the correct class name
will make it easier for deployers to configure federation.

bp identity-providers

Change-Id: I0f69d3465be78079a89e6d2c5e717aed04136a50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/23/69223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make --bypass-url default to env(BYPASS_URL)

This helps everyone avoid providing --bypass-url all the time when
they're using a proxy.

Change-Id: I54ebc344fe7f16bbe259feede1bf968e2da25a17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient refs/changes/66/69466/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default=cliutils.env('BYPASS_URL', default=None),

Refactor display of a job

deleted_lines: job = cs.job_executions.get(args.id) job._info['status'] = job._info['info']['status'] del job._info['info'] utils.print_dict(job._info)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/85/69785/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # look at https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/Documentation/devices.txt # KVM virtio volumes has code 252 in CentOS, but 253 in Ubuntu # Please also update the device codes here # https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-astute/blob/master/mcagents/erase_node.rb#L81 STORAGE_CODES = [3, 8, 65, 66, 67, 68, 69, 70, 71, 104, 105, 106, 107, 108, 109, 110, 111, 202, 252, 253] if STORAGE_CODES.include?(properties['MAJOR'].to_i) && removable =~ /^0$/
deleted_lines: # look at https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/Documentation/devices.txt # KVM virtio volumes has code 252 in CentOS, but 253 in Ubuntu # Please also update the device codes here # https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-astute/blob/master/mcagents/erase_node.rb#L81 if [3, 8, 104, 105, 106, 107, 108, 109, 110, 111, 202, 252, 253].include?(properties['MAJOR'].to_i) && removable =~ /^0$/

commit_message:
Fix problem with retry of mcollective tasks

* Fix problem with retry of mcollective tasks;
* Fix test to detect such behavior in future.

Change-Id: I5ee77caf9d9754415a636283d238e1bbc33d1b16
Related-Bug: #1268701
Closes-Bug: #1273772
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/10/69810/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mclient = MClient.new(@ctx, "faketest", nodes.map {|x| x['uid']}, check_result=true, timeout=nil, retries=1)

commit_message:
Implement ZooKeeper as persistence storage backend

Test cases are in taskflow/tests/unit/persistence/test_zk_persistence
and taskflow/tests/unit/persistence/test_zake_persistence. The former
requires a working ZooKeeper cluster, and the latter uses a fake
in-memory backend. Right now, due to the lack of ZooKeeper in Jenkins,
the former test is disabled. To enable it, simply uncomment the code
and change "hosts" in conf to your ZooKeeper cluster's addresses.

Also moved some shared helper functions from
taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_dir to
taskflow/utils/persistence_utils.

Implements: blueprint zk-logbook

Change-Id: Ia1b7ef8312a1761515515fd206b36be135119737

commit_message:
Extending quota support neutron LBaaS entities

Extending quota mechanism to support neutron
LBaaS entities. Adding quota for vips, pools, members
and health monitors.

This is one of three changes related to the BP.
This one is for python-neutronclient package.
Another one is for neutron project
and another one for horizon/openstack-dashboard project.

See blueprint neutron-quota-extension for another two changes.

Change-Id: I7fd70428e178da6772586a9f60c7d96f7e13e1f4
Implements: blueprint neutron-quota-extension

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-28 15:22:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/02420c6bd2de9a5df28718bae7b278f6c2b2c00a', 'message': "Ensure libvirtd is always configured on Red Hat

commit_message:
Ensure libvirtd is always configured on Red Hat

The code that populates libvirtd.conf on Red Hat operating systems was
scoped under a conditional that checks for user's presence in the
libvirtd group. This meant that when the libvirtd group already
existed and user was a member of that group, libvirtd.conf would not
get populated.

Move out the code that populates libvirtd.conf to top level (it is
guarded by grep anyway), and also move out the code that ensures
libvirtd group exists before it is used in libvirtd configuration.

Minor cleanup: "grep ... > /dev/null" changed to "grep -q ..."

Change-Id: Ie81a2ac883304e546fc95e8b5a2201bcaea9fc9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/27/69627/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: getent group $LIBVIRTD_GROUP || sudo groupadd $LIBVIRTD_GROUPif [ "$os" = "redhat" ]; then libvirtd_file=/etc/libvirt/libvirtd.conf if ! sudo grep "^unix_sock_group" $libvirtd_file > /dev/null; then sudo sed -i "s/^#unix_sock_group.*/unix_sock_group = \"$LIBVIRTD_GROUP\"/g" $libvirtd_file sudo sed -i 's/^#auth_unix_rw.*/auth_unix_rw = "none"/g' $libvirtd_file sudo sed -i 's/^#unix_sock_rw_perms.*/unix_sock_rw_perms = "0770"/g' $libvirtd_file sudo service libvirtd restart fi fi
deleted_lines: getent group $LIBVIRTD_GROUP || sudo groupadd $LIBVIRTD_GROUP if [ "$os" = "redhat" ]; then libvirtd_file=/etc/libvirt/libvirtd.conf if ! sudo grep "^unix_sock_group" $libvirtd_file > /dev/null; then sudo sed -i "s/^#unix_sock_group.*/unix_sock_group = \"$LIBVIRTD_GROUP\"/g" $libvirtd_file sudo sed -i 's/^#auth_unix_rw.*/auth_unix_rw = "none"/g' $libvirtd_file sudo sed -i 's/^#unix_sock_rw_perms.*/unix_sock_rw_perms = "0770"/g' $libvirtd_file sudo service libvirtd restart fi fi

commit_message:
Add oslo.messaging options back to nova.conf.sample

Sync two changes from oslo-incubator generator:

  e8e636c generator: add an EXTRA_LIBRARIES env variable
  6da13e8 generator: rename EXTRA_MODULES_FILE to RC_FILE

oslo.messaging to EXTRA_LIBRARIES and re-run the generator to restore
the oslo.messaging options to nova.conf.sample.

Change-Id: I524bfec405edd071a82393752e59c462a7ac0203
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/57/69357/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export NOVA_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_LIBRARIES=oslo.messaging

commit_message:
Extending quota support for neutron LBaaS entities

Extending quota mechanism to support neutron
LBaaS entities. Adding quota for vips, pools, members
and health monitors.

This is one of four changes related to the BP.
This one is for neutron project.
Another one is for python-neutronclient package,
another one for tempest,
and another one for horizon/openstack-dashboard project

See blueprint neutron-quota-extension for another two changes.

Change-Id: I095e4639cb48d832931567585efe8b2ee2c3dfd1
Implements: blueprint neutron-quota-extension

added_lines: default=['network', 'subnet', 'port', 'vip', 'pool', 'member', 'health_monitor'], cfg.IntOpt('quota_vip', default=10, help=_('Number of vips allowed per tenant, minus for ' 'unlimited')), cfg.IntOpt('quota_pool', default=10, help=_('Number of pools allowed per tenant, minus for ' 'unlimited')), cfg.IntOpt('quota_member', default=30, help=_('Number of members allowed per tenant, minus for ' 'unlimited')), cfg.IntOpt('quota_health_monitor', default=10, help=_('Number of health monitors allowed per tenant, minus for ' 'unlimited')),

commit_message:
Change the V3 PCI API xml template to keep naming consistency

This patch changes the PCI XML the TemplateElement tag name to keep
the style as others in API. And also changes the template class name
"HypervisorDetailTemplate" to "PciHypervisorDetailTemplate".

Change-Id: Iab39a171189082693b92f34c7fd5f2725ca20b5b

commit_message:
Convert keystoneclient commands in lib/keystone to openstackclient

Change instances of keystoneclient commands (like keystone user-
create, or tenant-list) to openstackclient commands.

Also modify stack.sh to account for renamed environment variables.

Change-Id: I2995764027cd618b87edb9514199f409891c1579

commit_message:
Automatic configuration of local_ip in ovs_neutron_plugin.ini

Previously only a literal IP address was allowed as a value of local_ip.
Since the value differs for each host, an admin could not reuse a single
ovs_neutron_plugin.ini in multiple hosts.

With this patch, a string "auto" is allowed and is the default value.
At run-time, it is replaced to the IP address of the interface connected
to the default gateway. It makes the reuse of ovs_neutron_plugin.ini
possible.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1267021
Change-Id: I1e6d614e372db72cc968bfd685ad618324b91c53
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/53/64253/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_local_ip_for_default_route(): devices = ip_lib.IPWrapper().get_devices(exclude_loopback=True) for device in devices: gateway = device.route.get_gateway() if gateway: for addr in device.addr.list(): if (addr.get('ip_version') != 4 or addr.get('scope') != 'global'): continue t = addr.get('cidr', '').partition('/') if t[0] and t[1] and t[2]: return t[0] return None if kwargs['local_ip'] == 'auto': auto_local_ip = _get_local_ip_for_default_route() if not auto_local_ip: msg = _('Cannot determine a value of local_ip automatically.') raise ValueError(msg) LOG.info('local_ip=auto is treated as local_ip=%s', auto_local_ip) kwargs['local_ip'] = auto_local_ip

commit_message:
Catch backend store exceptions in API layer

The Glance API layer currently doesn't catch some exceptions raised by
the backend storage layer (e.g. if the backend storage server is
down when an image download is requested), resulting in a "500
Internal Server Error". This happens both for v1 and v2 APIs.

This commit narrows the exceptions that can be raised by a backend
store and adds exception handling for exceptions raised by the backend
store.

Closes-bug: #1264029
Change-Id: Ib85bced3d4950c5bda1d6ce5c8f1bdd355d2f475

commit_message:
External image url validation added

A validation was created that checks if an external url location
provided for a new image is valid or reacheable.  This change ensures
that only valid images are hosted.

Change-Id: I0d3db61cf0435ed2f6c3ba821c264b7fef6ef27e
Closes-Bug: #1261893

commit_message:
Cmd manage commands parse positional args

Currently all db commands in glance do not care about
non-positional args, e.g. --version
So for example:
glance-manage db upgrade --version 1111
will work as if version was not passed

This is a kind of blocker that doesn't allow to extend
db manage commands for alembic usage

Change-Id: Ifc8d8ed56223d9903d2e37266c174f1d5a10fcc8
Closes-Bug: #1261348

commit_message:
Glanceclient should switch to using bufferedhttp

Glanceclient should switch to using bufferedhttp like in swift which
makes up for missing features in traditional httplib, for eg)
buffering http headers, support for 'Expect: 100-continue' etc.
This patch pulls in the bufferedhttp from swift.

Related to bp use-buffered-http-inglance-client

Change-Id: Iba37192c2038db9ddb34873ef546810ef83882ce

implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import testtools from savannadashboard.tests import base import savannadashboard.tests.configs.config as cfg class UIUpdateNodeGroupTemplate(base.UITestCase): @base.attr(tags=['node_group_template', 'vanilla']) @testtools.skipIf(cfg.vanilla.skip_plugin_tests, 'tests for vanilla plugin skipped') def test_update_node_group_template_vanilla(self): self.create_node_group_template( "selenium-vanilla", ["NN", "JT"], cfg.vanilla, flavor="m1.small", storage={'type': "Cinder Volume", 'volume_per_node': '2', 'volume_size': '6'}, description='selenium-test', params=[{"HDFS Parameters:Show_param": True}, {"hadoop.native.lib": False}, {"Filter": "heap"}, {"Name Node Heap Size": 512}, {"Data Node Heap Size": 512}, {"Show_param": False}, {"Filter": ""}, {"dfs.datanode.max.xcievers": 3555}, {"MapReduce Parameters:io.sort.mb": 200}, {"mapred.child.java.opts": "-Xmx300m"}]) self.update_node_group_template( "selenium-vanilla-update", ["NN", "JT", "HDFS_CLIENT"], cfg.vanilla, positive=False) self.delete_node_group_templates(['selenium-vanilla']) @base.attr(tags=['node_group_template', 'hdp']) @testtools.skipIf(cfg.hdp.skip_plugin_tests, 'tests for hdp plugin skipped') def test_update_node_group_template_hdp(self): self.create_node_group_template( "sel-hdp", ["NN", "JT", "HDFS_CLIENT", "AMBARI_SERVER", "AMBARI_AGENT"], cfg.hdp, flavor="m1.small", storage={'type': "Cinder Volume", 'volume_per_node': '2', 'volume_size': '6'}, description='selenium-test') self.update_node_group_template("sel-hdp-update", ["NN", "JT"], cfg.hdp, positive=False) self.delete_node_group_templates(['sel-hdp'])

commit_message:
Add ticket handling to KDS

Adds creation of tickets to transmit communication keys between peers.

SecurityImpact
blueprint: key-distribution-server
Change-Id: I4dbd23adb0bdd9011eb9a0b45e30dd862d390473
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/04/59604/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import base64 import pecan from pecan import rest import wsme import wsmeext.pecan as wsme_pecan from keystone.contrib.kds.api.v1 import models from keystone.openstack.common import jsonutils class TicketController(rest.RestController): @wsme.validate(models.Ticket) @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(models.Ticket, body=models.TicketRequest) def post(self, ticket_request): # verify all required fields present and the signature is correct ticket_request.verify() # create a new base key. With the combination of this base key and the # information available in the metadata a client can re-generate the # keys required for this session. rndkey = pecan.request.crypto.extract(ticket_request.source.key) # generate the keys to communicate between these two endpoints. enc_key, sig = pecan.request.crypto.generate_keys(rndkey, ticket_request.info) # encrypt the base key for the target, this can be used to generate # generate the sek on the target esek_data = {'key': base64.b64encode(rndkey), 'timestamp': ticket_request.time_str, 'ttl': ticket_request.ttl.seconds} esek = pecan.request.crypto.encrypt(ticket_request.destination.key, jsonutils.dumps(esek_data)) return ticket_request.new_response(enc_key, sig, esek)

commit_message:
Use aggregated values when get statistics

Implemented:
1. Get aggregates for queries that contain start, end and meter during get_statistics
2. Tests

Partially implements bp add-basic-ceilometer-tests

Change-Id: I22899d987ecd68978aa8b811c1ab9fec98f58c7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/70/67870/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy aggregated_keys = {'meter', 'start', 'end'} can_aggregate = sample_filter.start and sample_filter.end for k, v in sample_filter.__dict__.items(): if v and k not in aggregated_keys: can_aggregate = False break if not period and not groupby and can_aggregate: # Try to get aggregates from db. If not successful # then do it manually s, e, res = self.get_aggregates_if_possible(sample_filter, 'H') if res: first_filter = copy.copy(sample_filter) first_filter.end = s second_filter = copy.copy(sample_filter) second_filter.start = e left_res = list(self.statistics_helper(first_filter)) right_res = list(self.statistics_helper(second_filter)) # There is no period filter so we may be sure that if # first_res or second_res are not null they contain only # one element list_to_merge = [] list_to_merge.extend(left_res) list_to_merge.append(res) list_to_merge.extend(right_res) return _merge_stats(list_to_merge) return self.statistics_helper(sample_filter, period=period, groupby=groupby) def statistics_helper(self, sample_filter, period=None, groupby=None): """Return an iterable of api_models.Statistics instances containing meter statistics described by the query parameters. The filter must have a meter value set. """ def get_aggregates_if_possible(sample_filter, type): # NOTE: method is only for Hours aggregates now if type != 'H': LOG.warn("Cannot retrieve aggregate, only H type is supported") return None, None, None meter_name = sample_filter.meter start_ts = sample_filter.start end_ts = sample_filter.end # We need to get the next hour from beginning and the floored # hour for the end. # Example: # User wants to see statistics from 15:45 and 17:18. # In this case we may be interested in aggregates only for 16:00 # (samples are already aggregated for 16:00-17:00) # 15 minutes before 16:00 and 18 minutes after 17:00 should be # calculated manually. So we will get statistics for 16:00-17:00 from # aggregates. aggr_start = floor(start_ts) if start_ts != aggr_start: aggr_start += datetime.timedelta(hours=1) aggr_end = floor(end_ts) if aggr_start == aggr_end: return None, None, None session = sqlalchemy_session.get_session() query = session.query(models.Statistics) if meter_name: query = query.filter(models.Statistics.meter_name == meter_name) if aggr_start: query = query.filter(models.Statistics.period_start >= aggr_start) if aggr_end: query = query.filter(models.Statistics.period_start < aggr_end) list_for_merging = [] dates = [] for k in query.all(): list_for_merging.append(api_models.Statistics( unit=k.unit, count=k.count, min=k.min, max=k.max, avg=k.avg, sum=k.sum, period=k.period, period_start=k.period_start, period_end=k.period_end, duration=None, duration_start=None, duration_end=None, groupby=None)) dates.append(k.period_start) if not list_for_merging or not verify_aggregation(dates): return None, None, None res = _merge_stats(list_for_merging) # Add one hour to make right bound not inclusive[) return dates[0], dates[-1] + datetime.timedelta(hours=1), res @staticmethod def floor(dt): delta = datetime.timedelta(minutes=dt.minute, seconds=dt.second, microseconds=dt.microsecond) dt -= delta return dt def verify_aggregation(dates): prev = None for date in dates: if prev: delta = date - prev if delta != datetime.timedelta(hours=1): LOG.warn(_("Aggregates contain a gap")) # TODO(nprivalova): we may return as many gaps as exist, # TODO(nprivalova): None is temporary solution return False prev = date return True def _merge_stats(stats_list): if not stats_list: return None result = api_models.Statistics( unit='', count=stats_list[0].count, min=stats_list[0].min, max=stats_list[0].max, avg=stats_list[0].avg, sum=stats_list[0].sum, period=None, period_start=None, period_end=None, duration=None, duration_start=None, duration_end=None, groupby=None) for stat in stats_list[1:]: result.min = min(result.min, stat.min) result.max = max(result.max, stat.max) result.sum += int(stat.sum) result.count += int(stat.count) result.avg = (result.sum / float(result.count)) return result

commit_message:
Removes devstack duplicated code

Reasons:
- Devstack already has a code dopwnload mechanism, so no need to duplicate
  the code download in project-list, but Devstack does not gets the
  image-building projects, which need a separate treatment.
- Trove-integration contains devstack duplicated code in
  scripts/functions, we can reuse devstack code itself, instead of
  duplication.

Changes:
- Removed devstack duplicated code from scripts/functions.
- Edited projects-list to record only image-building projects.
- Replaced retried token with get_attribute_id.

Change-Id: I43fb88bde9e936fa05425e713664c83057d3861b
Closes-Bug: #1265159

subject: Relocates guest_config and its implementation
revisions:

Reasons:
- guest_config was pointing to a path of non-existent file.
- It is because of this wrong value that /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  was not building-up.

Changes:
- Corrected guest_config to point to the path where sample file existed.
- Now the correct file is read and values placed into the file,
  while building up nova instance.

Closes-Bug: #1265184
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-02 07:34:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/7cdc15991fac0dce7dce892e18bd9dc8fd9afdcf', 'message': 'Corrects guest_config value in cfg.py

Reasons:
- Bug: 1176102 in trove-integration says that we are using
  trove-guestagent.conf.sample, which should rather use the
  configuration files placed at /etc.
- _create_server has code to create the file /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  but was not working because of a false evaluating condition.
- guest_config was pointing to a path of non-existent file.
- It is because of this wrong value that /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  was not building-up.

Changes:
- Corrected guest_config to point to the path where sample file existed.
- Now the correct file is read and values placed into the file,
  while building up nova instance.

Change-Id: I0a44c3d6c13e40ac33a3209a7921f41f7b7eb6c6
Closes-Bug: #1265184
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-02 20:38:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/ea14860680677849711acd4c499ecbbf2c7d5e38', 'message': 'Relocates guest_config and its implementation

Reasons:
- Bug: 1176102 in trove-integration says that we are using
  trove-guestagent.conf.sample, which should rather use the
  configuration files placed at /etc.
- _create_server has code to create the file /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  but was not working because of a false evaluating condition.
- guest_config was pointing to the path of a non-existent file.
- It is because of this wrong value that /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  was not building-up.
- Need to use Jinja to implement templates if needed in future.

Changes:
- Relocated trove-guestagent.conf to bring inside the trove code.
- Now this relocated configuration file could be read by Jinja.
- Added template.load_guestagent_conf & its tests to read configuration
  file as a Jinja template.
- Corrected guest_config to point to the path where sample file existed.
- Updated taskmanager.models tests with mocked instance of
  template.load_guestagent_conf for existing tests.
- Now the correct file is read and values placed into the file,
  while building up nova instance.

Change-Id: I0a44c3d6c13e40ac33a3209a7921f41f7b7eb6c6
Closes-Bug: #1265184
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-02 20:45:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/c07760563c948bf879e04726fca30ace6b8ee1c5', 'message': 'Relocates guest_config and its implementation

Reasons:
- Bug: 1176102 in trove-integration says that we are using
  trove-guestagent.conf.sample, which should rather use the
  configuration files placed at /etc.
- _create_server has code to create the file /etc/trove-guestagent.conf

- It is because of this wrong value that /etc/trove-guestagent.conf

- Added template.load_guestagent_conf & its tests to read configuration
  file as a Jinja template.

- Updated taskmanager.models tests with mocked instance of
  template.load_guestagent_conf for existing tests.

commit_message:
Relocates guest_config and its implementation

Reasons:
- Bug: 1176102 in trove-integration says that we are using
  trove-guestagent.conf.sample, which should rather use the
  configuration files placed at /etc.
- _create_server has code to create the file /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  but was not working because of a false evaluating condition.
- guest_config was pointing to the path of a non-existent file.
- It is because of this wrong value that /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  was not building-up.
- Need to use Jinja to implement templates for configuration file,
  if needed in future.
- Need for different configs for different datastore types in future.
- Two configuration files being used.

Changes:
- Relocated trove-guestagent.conf to bring it inside the trove code.
- Now this relocated configuration file is read using Jinja.
- Added template.load_guestagent_conf & its tests to read configuration
  file as a Jinja template.
- Removed guest_config, as config is now under common
  datastore-template kind pattern.
- Updated taskmanager.models tests with mocked instance of
  template.load_guestagent_conf for existing tests.
- guest_info & guest_config have been merged to a single file for guest.
- Now the correct file is read and values placed into the file,
  while building up nova instance.
- Keeping the sample file since trove-integration reads the sample file to
  create its environment, this could be later removed after
  trove-integration change.

Change-Id: I0a44c3d6c13e40ac33a3209a7921f41f7b7eb6c6
Closes-Bug: #1265184

commit_message:
Template management functions for autoscaling

This refactors two important chunks of logic into a separate module:
- update_template, which creates a new template of N resources while
  minimizing changes relative to a previous template
- get_batches_for_rolling_update, which returns a list of templates
  for use in a rolling-update process.

This code is being refactored to separate it from other concerns of the Heat
engine, such as scheduling and storage. It's meant to be used by either
the separate autoscaling service (to come) or in-process autoscaling
resources, or other third party users.

Care was taken to maintain compatibility with existing code. Some behavior
which was previously untested now has unit tests.

The functions are kept pure to facilitate easy unit testing.

partial blueprint as-lib

Change-Id: Ieafa4b6cf0bfda7aa1be8fd2c5b12c437c637ed8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/06/67006/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Autoscaling core logic. These are the pure functions that do the bulk of the autoscale logic. """ from heat.common import short_id def update_template(old_resources, resource_definition, units, replacements=0): """ Generate a new template with a certain number of duplicate resources. :param old_resources: A list of dicts with "name" and "template" keys. Order matters, since it will affect which units get replaced. This parameter is only relevant if 'replacements' is passed -- if more old resources exist than the number of allowed replacements, they will be left in tact with their template from old_resources. :param resource_definition: The template for a single unit, not including the name. :param units: The number of units (copies of the resource) that the new template should have. :param replacements: The maximum number of resources to replace if the resource definition has changed. """ units_difference = units - len(old_resources) replacements -= units_difference old_resources.sort( key=lambda resource: int(resource['template'] != resource_definition)) resources = [] for i in range(units): if i < len(old_resources): old_resource = old_resources[i] if (old_resource['template'] != resource_definition and replacements > 0): replacements -= 1 resources.append({ 'name': old_resource['name'], 'template': resource_definition}) else: # If the template changed but we've depleted our allowed number # of replacements, continue using the old template. resources.append(old_resource) else: resources.append({ 'name': short_id.generate_id(), 'template': resource_definition}) return resources def get_batches_for_rolling_update(old_resources, resource_definition, min_resources, batch_size): """ Return a series of templates that can be used to perform a rolling update on a stack. :param old_resources: A list of dicts with "name" and "template" keys. Order matters. :param resource_definition: The template for a single unit, not including the name. :param min_resources: The minimum number of resources to maintain in a "running" status in the template. :param batch_size: The number of new resources to create at a time. """ size = len(old_resources) batch_size = min(batch_size, size) min_resources = min(min_resources, size) # effective capacity includes temporary capacity added to accomodate # the minimum number of instances in service during update efft_capacity = max(size - batch_size, min_resources) + batch_size batches = [] remainder = size while remainder > 0 or efft_capacity > size: if size - remainder >= min_resources: # We're done adding new resources, but we need to clean up some # to get back down to the desired size. efft_capacity = size resources = update_template(old_resources, resource_definition, efft_capacity, replacements=batch_size) batches.append(resources) old_resources = resources remainder -= batch_size return batches

commit_message:
Fixes autodoc_tree_index_modules

The arguments originally being passed into sphinx.apidoc specified '.'
as the path to index. Unfortunately this includes the setup.py module.
Sphinx dies while trying to process the setup.rst likely because the
setup.py module calls setuptools.setup() when imported causing some sort
of recursion.

sphinx.apidoc will now be called with the path to the root package of
the project. Additionally the module index is a little nicer because it
includes the name of the package in the title.

Closes-Bug: #1260495

Change-Id: I82ef1d46b07740152e8be95454f91c4f452ad8a2

deleted_lines: source_dir = self._get_source_dir() apidoc.main(['apidoc', '.', '-H', 'Modules', '-o', source_dir]) # but they do a very similar thing in a difffernet way
